title: Requires school bus transportation contracts to include a provision holding school bus contractors harmless for certain school bus safety improvements
summary: Requires school bus transportation contracts to include a provision holding school bus companies harmless for certain school bus safety improvements mandated during the course of the contract or contract renewal.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         3435

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 25, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. CALHOUN -- read once and referred to the Commit-
         tee on Education

       AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation to expenses incurred  for
         school bus safety improvements

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The education law is amended by adding a new section 3625-a
    2  to read as follows:
    3    S 3625-A. SCHOOL BUS SAFETY IMPROVEMENTS.  ANY  CONTRACT  OR  CONTRACT
    4  RENEWAL FOR THE TRANSPORTATION OF SCHOOL CHILDREN AUTHORIZED PURSUANT TO
    5  SECTION  THIRTY-SIX  HUNDRED  TWENTY-FIVE  OF  THIS PART SHALL INCLUDE A
    6  PROVISION WHEREBY THE CONTRACTOR PROVIDING PUPIL TRANSPORTATION SERVICES
    7  SHALL BE HELD HARMLESS FOR EXPENSES INCURRED BY SUCH  CONTRACTOR  DURING
    8  THE COURSE OF THE CONTRACT OR CONTRACT RENEWAL AS A RESULT OF SCHOOL BUS
    9  SAFETY  IMPROVEMENTS MANDATED BY LAW, RULE OR REGULATION AND NOT REASON-
   10  ABLY FORESEEN AT THE TIME THE  CONTRACT  WAS  EXECUTED.  THE  DEPARTMENT
   11  SHALL  BE  RESPONSIBLE  FOR  SUCH ADDITIONAL EXPENSES. THE DEPARTMENT OF
   12  TRANSPORTATION SHALL ESTABLISH A PROCEDURE TO REVIEW THE  REASONABLENESS
   13  AND  LEGITIMACY  OF CLAIMS MADE BY THE CONTRACTOR PROVIDING PUPIL TRANS-
   14  PORTATION SERVICES TO THE DEPARTMENT FOR SUCH ADDITIONAL EXPENSES.
   15    S 2. This act shall take effect on the first of July  next  succeeding
   16  the  date  on  which  it  shall have become a law and shall apply to any
   17  contract executed on or after such date.



        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD02742-01-1
